Package infodynamics.measures.spiking.integration

Class TransferEntropyCalculatorSpikingIntegration

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.spiking.integration.TransferEntropyCalculatorSpikingIntegration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
    public class TransferEntropyCalculatorSpikingIntegration
extends java.lang.Object
implements TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
    Computes the transfer entropy between a pair of spike trains, using an integration-based measure in order to match the theoretical form of TE between such spike trains.

    Usage paradigm is as per the interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Field Detail

      • DEST_PAST_INTERVALS_PROP_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEST_PAST_INTERVALS_PROP_NAME
        The past destination interspike intervals to consider (and associated property name and convenience length variable) The code assumes that the first interval is numbered 1, the next is numbered 2, etc. It also assumes that the intervals are sorted. The setter method performs sorting to ensure this.
        See Also:

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Sets properties for the TE calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.K_PROP_NAME -- destination history embedding length k (default value 1)
        • TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.L_PROP_NAME -- embedding length for the source past history vector (default value 1)
        • TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.TIMESORTED_PROP_NAME -- whether each series of time stamps of spikes is sorted into temporal order. (default "true")

        Note: further properties may be defined by child classes.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value, or if the property is recognised but unsupported (eg some calculators do not support all of the embedding properties).

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Get current property values for the calculator.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, are the same as those for TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.setProperty(String, String)

        Unknown property values are responded to with a null return value.

        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations​(double[] source,
                            double[] destination)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Sets a single set of spiking observations from which to compute the PDF for transfer entropy. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Parameters:
        source - series of time stamps of spikes for the source variable.
        destination - series of time stamps of spikes for the destination variable. Length will generally be different to the source, unlike other transfer entropy implementations, e.g. for TransferEntropyCalculator. source and destination must have the same reference time point, and each array is assumed to be sorted into temporal order unless the property TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.TIMESORTED_PROP_NAME has been set to false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Specified by:
        startAddObservations in interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations​(double[] source,
                            double[] destination)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking

        Adds a new set of spiking observations to update the PDFs with. It is intended to be called multiple times, and must be called after TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.startAddObservations(). Call TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append or overlay these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them as independent trials - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

        Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking
        Parameters:
        source - series of time stamps of spikes for the source variable. Will be returned in ascending sorted order.
        destination - series of time stamps of spikes for the destination variable. Length will generally be different to the source, unlike other transfer entropy implementations, e.g. for TransferEntropyCalculator. source and destination must have the same reference time point, and each array is assumed to be sorted into temporal order unless the property TransferEntropyCalculatorSpiking.TIMESORTED_PROP_NAME has been set to false. Will be returned in ascending sorted order.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public void addObservations​(double[] source,
